review.title: Knowing Whether
review.abstract: Knowing whether a proposition is true means knowing that it is true or knowing that it is false. In this paper, we study logics with a modal operator Kw for knowing whether but without a modal operator K for knowing that. This logic is not a normal modal logic, because we do not have that Kw phi -> Kw psi and Kw phi implies Kw psi. Knowing whether logic cannot define many common frame properties, and its expressive power less than that of basic modal logic over classes of models without reflexivity. These features make axiomatizing knowing whether logics non-trivial. We axiomatize knowing whether logic over various frame classes. We also present an extension of knowing whether logic with public announcement operators and we give corresponding reduction axioms for that. We compare our work in detail to two recent similar proposals.

sections.heading: 8 Conclusions and further research
sections.text: We summarize our contributions first. • We gave the complete axiomatization of PLKw via frame classes K, D, 5, 45, S4 and S5. • PLKw cannot define frame classes D, T, B, 4 and 5. • PLKw is less meaningful than model classes K, D, 4 and 5. It is just as expressive as EL via T (and classes in T, such as S4 and S5). • We axiomatized the logic of knowledge, whether it is with public announcements, PLKwA, and demonstrated that it is just as expressive as PLKw. • Axiomatization PLK is synonymous with logic.
